Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice dress, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's not a dress. It's a kurta.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tonight, one of our most ethnic co-workers, Kelly, has invited us all to a Diwali celebration put on by her community. What is Diwali, you may ask? Well, to have Kelly explain it [girly voice] it's ada blah blah blah, it's so super fun and it's going to be great. [normal voice] Lot of gods with unpronounceable names. Twenty minutes later you find out that is essentially a Hindu Halloween.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You look so handsome.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really you do. I love the material.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How come you didn't get me one?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ok, so, between Meredith's Mini-van and if I borrow Bob's Yukon that should fit about twelve people.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I actually might not go. Feeling kind of tired.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Do you want to make Appletini's and watch 'Sex and the City' at my place?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. I haven't decided yet.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't get why you won't go. Did I do something wrong? I mean, I thought we were really close friends.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just feel kind of tired, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe you've got mono.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe. I just ...I don't really have anyone to go with.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, go with Dwight. He's single, too. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally single. Hundred percent available.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you guys going to this Indian thing tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I don't know. Who's... uh, who's going?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooh. Do you mean like, is Pam going?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't go. They eat monkey brains.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey. Stop that. That is offensive. Indians do not eat monkey brains. And if they do... sign me up... because I am sure that they are very tasty and nutritional.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's important that this company celebrates its diversity. And you know what, Stanley? Come Kwanzaa time, I have got you covered, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't celebrate Kwanzaa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wha? Really? You should! It's fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love the people here. And if there was one thing I di... don't really care for is that they can be terribly, terribly ignorant about other cultures. And I don't want them embarrassing me in front of my girlfriend, Carol.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Diwali is a very important holiday for the Hindus. But, frankly, I'm a little appalled that none of you know very much about Indian culture. So, without further ado, Kelly you are on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um... Diwali is awesome... and there's food... and there's going to be dancing... and... Oh! I got the raddest outfit. It has, um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sparkles...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... why don't you tell us a little bit about the origins of the holiday.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, um... I don't know. It's really old, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How many gods do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Like hundreds, I think. Maybe more than that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [points at picture on the wall] And that blue busty gal? What's her story?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She looks like Pam from the neck down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam wishes. [generalized laughing] Kelly, I'll take this one. Diwali is a Celebration of the Coronation of the God-King Rama. After his epic battle with Ravana, the Demon King of Lanka. It symbolizes the battle between good and evil...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, all right, all right, all right. This isn't 'Lord of the Rings'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I started biking into work. Josh does it and he lives a lot farther away than I do. And also it saves gas money, keeps me in shape... helps the environment. And now I know it makes me really sweaty for work.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Nice basket.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now, a lot of people say that Kelly is one in a million and that's true, but it's also not true. Because, frankly, there are literally billions of people just like Kelly in the world. Here are some famous Indians. [slide show] Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He is a Nobel prize-winning physicist. Impressive. Apu from the Simpsons. Hilarious. Indian. M. Night Shyamalan. 'The Village', 'Unbreakable', 'Sixth Sense', 'Sig... '

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I see dead people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Spoiler... alert.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He was dead the whole time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just stop it. [slide of Michael & Carol kissing] What's the... oh, whoa! [laughs] Where did that come from?

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: Karen, my chips got stuck in the vending machine again. I need your skinny, little arms.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh. Did you shake it?

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: Yeah, I shook it, I shook it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We have such a roller coaster thing, Karen and I.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 'Scuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Roller-coastery friendship. Hot. Cold. On again. Off again. Sexual tension filled type of deal. It's very Sam and Diane.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: From 'Cheers'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And another thing about the Indian people... they love sex positions. I present to you the Kama Sutra. I mean look at that. Who's seen that before?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I have. That's the 'Union of the Monkey'.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, that's what they call it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is the best meeting we've ever had.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I find this incredibly offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I find it beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, whatever Kelly wants to do in her own house is fine but we shouldn't all be subjected to it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Actually, she's right. This isn't appropriate. Why don't I take these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, You're not going to collect them.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. This is delightful, charming culture.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My Indian Culture Seminar was going great until Toby decided that he was too immature to deal with culturally explicit images. It's just sex. People... everybody does it. I'm doing it... with Carol! Probably tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: All right. Think you guys should be all set. Oh, here's the corporate card for dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: And Karen? Let's keep it to twenty dollars a person this time.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Once a quarter, the sales staff at this branch has to stay late to do order form consolidation... which, amazingly, is even less interesting than it sounds.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You guys ready to party?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I said are you ready TO PARTY!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Isn't this fun? Not wearing shoes?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wish some of us still had our shoes on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Stop it. It's a disease! I've told you.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: [wearing cheerleader costume] I thought you said this was a costume party!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points at woman] What does that look like to you?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: An Indian woman in a sari.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No one's even going to notice.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice outfit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Kevin. It's a costume. Why don't you just cool it, okay? Carol? Carol.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll have one of those as well. Thank you very much. Now these are limes, lemons, onions...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm a vegetarian. What can I eat?

Quote.Speaker: Server
Quote.Text: It's all vegetarian.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'll just have some bread. You used your hands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yuck. [spits out food]

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: What? Too spicy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. These s'mores are disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: They're not s'mores. They're samosas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think they have any s'mores?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All they are is chocolate, graham cracker, and marshmallow. How difficult would that have been?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So, you're Kelly's sisters, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Girls
Quote.Text: [laugh] Kelly Zach Braff [speaks in Hindi]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ruka, Nipa, Tiffany. Stop acting like such little losers and just be cool. Come on, Ryan. Come on. Leave him alone. I hate you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: They said something about Zach Braff.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't even listen to them. They're so...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, you don't...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Very official.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I decided to come. Uh... I feel a little under-dressed... but at least I'm not dressed like a slutty cheerleader, right? Is that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Temp! Temp! Pflut! Pflut!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't even want to hear it. Okay. I didn't come this Diwali to get yelled at!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Mom
Quote.Text: Stop it right now. Ryan is a temporary worker, makes no money. Wally is a whole doctor. So handsome.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uh... excuse me. I want to get a...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Mom
Quote.Text: He's a perfect match.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Big Tuna, you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One. Two. Three. Shot!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Holy Mother of God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, that burns! Golly. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Overhead
Quote.Text: [song by Beyonce Knowles] Looking so crazy, my baby. I'm not myself lately. I'm foolish. I don't do this. I've been playing myself. Baby I don't care. Cuz your love got the best of me. And baby you're making a fool of me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, thirty years? And you two only met once before the wedding night?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Father
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Father
Quote.Text: How long have you been married to the cheerleader?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! She's not a cheerleader. She thought this was a costume party! Um... no, we're not married... yet!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Mom
Quote.Text: She is very fair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She is. Very fair and very kind. So... um... tell me, is your marriage the kind of thing where when you die she has to throw herself on a fire? No? Okay. It's still very cool. Ok. Thanks!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One. Two. Three. Shot!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to be. [to DJ] Hi, I'm just going to get this for a sec... just a sec. [speaks in microphone] Um... everyone? I'm sorry, could I have your attention, please. Thank you. Ah-hah... Hi. Sorry. I just have an announcement to make. Um... okay. I have learned a lot about Indian culture tonight. But I have learned even more about love. And I know you're all thinking 'who is this crazy gringo and what is he talking about?' Well, I'm not crazy. Maybe I'm crazy in love. So without further ado, Carol? Carol Stills. I would like you to do me the honor of making me your husband.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: Awww!

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you say?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Can we talk about this in private?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't hear you. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: [louder] Can we talk about this in private?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [lowers microphone] Oh, you've got to be kidding me. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I get it. I get it. You're not ready. We'll wait. This is a classic...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: This is the ninth date, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, but I ... I feel like I've known you many lifetimes. Maybe I'm Hindu after all. Okay, I'm not Hindu, but... Carol. Carol, I just... I feel like... I just like you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I better go. Okay, you can find a way home, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Okay. Good night. [louder] Hey, you know what? Why don't I come with you. Cause I've got this book called the Kama Sutra.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Okay, good night, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, I was a Temp but I got promoted. So, um... the compensation is a lot more competitive.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Mom
Quote.Text: So you're saving money...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Mom
Quote.Text: ...to start a family and home.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, um... or travel. And,um... and buy an Xbox.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly's Father
Quote.Text: Is there anything you wanted to ask us tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you believe my boss proposed to his girlfriend in public? That is so Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Young Man
Quote.Text: Is it? He's really outgoing, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Hey, would you excuse me for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's hot in there. How's the naan?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dry. You look like you were having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am. You should come dance with us.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to watch our shoes so they don't get stolen. Who were you texting?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings Indigo Girls] I went to the doctor. I went to the mountains. I looked to the children...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Andy, no acappella.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings] I looked to the children, I drank from the fountain.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Jim
Quote.Text: [sing] There's more than one answer to these questions pointing me in a crooked line

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait, wait.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Jim
Quote.Text: [sing] the less I seek my source...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, guys. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Jim
Quote.Text: [sing] the closer I am to fi-i-i-ne. The closer I am to..

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: It's not good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Jim
Quote.Text: [sing] fi-i-i-ine!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: TUNA! Are you kidding me!!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God! [chokes on food] Oh. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here. [hands drink]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's so spicy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. You waiting for a call?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh... no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Pam. When Carol said 'No.' tonight, I think I finally realized how you must be feeling. We are both the victims of broken engagements.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you were never really engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was in that marriage arena, though.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Uuuuh... well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I kind of thought something would happen tonight too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're so alike. So alike. [leans in to kiss her]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm rejecting your...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm... what? I didn't

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...kiss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [scoffing noises] Can I have a ride home?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you sit in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Goodnight, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I have a ride, man? I... uh... I have my bike.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No way, dude. I am not driving home. I have brought an inflatable bed for just such occasions. You're welcome to share it though. It's a roomy twin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey dummy, get in the car!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm a drunk driver.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yes, you are. Here. Let me take that. Just... uh... get in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Man, you can really hold your liquor, Billabelli.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, you can't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No kidding. And I am just going to lie down in the back, if that's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Sure. Here's your bag. Just don't puke on anything. You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So good.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These are not my shoes. This is just like that show 'Taxi Cab Confessions'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You say one more word; I'm stopping the car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is going out to Indians everywhere. It's a tribute to one of the greats... Mr. Adam Sandler. [sings] Diwali is a festival of lights. Let me tell you something. Tonight has been one crazy night. So put on your saris, it's time to celebrate Diwali. Everybody looks so jolly. But it's not Christmas, it's Diwali. The goddess of destruction Kali stopped by to celebrate Diwali. Don't invite any zombies to a celebration of Diwali. Along came Polly to have some fun at Diwali. If you're Indian and you love to party, have a happy, happy, happy, happy Diwali. Happy Diwali!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [loud clapping, cheering, and whistling]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do I explain this to Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, well, basically, it's like a really big party, and everybody gets super-dressed up, and there's a bunch of different gods, and each of the gods has a special power, like the Care Bears, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, please, stop talking. Three words or less.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Like, an Indian Halloween?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An Indian Halloween. Okay, great. [to phone] Pam, could you put Jan on, please?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Michael, you're on with Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, what is this about you letting everyone leave work early today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I was letting everybody go to the big Diwali party.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What is Diwali?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is Diwali?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't know what Diwali is? Wow, Jan. I'm surprised. It's the Hindu festival of lights. I just assumed you'd be familiar with it. It's the most sacred and honored Hindu holiday in the world. It's like Christmas, Easter, and Halloween--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mich--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: --rolled into one.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I bet you're not even aware that our own Kelly Kapoor, who works in...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, customer service.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... customer service is a Hindu person.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, of course, I know Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I thought she was Muslim.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What? I'm not Muslim!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I think it sounds lovely. I think it sounds like a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You do?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, of course. It's important to celebrate our company's rich diversity. And, and in fact, Michael, if you had planned better, we might have been able to charter a bus to the event--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I dunno about that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: --or, or, or been a sponsor for the party itself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For Kelly, that seems a bit much.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hey, one person is an integral part of the fabric--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She's so wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, you should see her naked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I had promised Carol a romantic evening on the town. Um, I wanted to take her on this spooky hay ride thing, but it was like seventy dollars a person, and she's allergic to hay. So I said, "Pop a Claritin, and I will spot you the seventy bucks," and she's like "I don't like to borrow money or take unnecessary medication." And I'm like, "Well you're really not gonna like what I slipped in your drink last night." And she's like, "What the hell are you talking about?" And I'm like, "I'm kidding. I didn't put a roof..." [cracks himself up] ... We laughed so hard... It was hilarious... oh... [calms down] So yes, I'm very excited about the Diwali party.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: For Diwali 07, you must consider Scrantonicity. For a fraction of the cost of this DJ, you could have the rocking sound stylings of a Police cover band.

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Kapoor
Quote.Text: No Police cover.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, okay, well, let me send you a demo, and... Better yet, I'll give Kelly the demo, and she can give it to you. It'll save us both on postage.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Kapoor
Quote.Text: [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: You're the temp!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, yeah. [shakes her hand] Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Carol.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hi, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: The wavy brown hair and blue eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael talks about you... a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Top of your class at business school, and you live on Shady Hill Road, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wow, um... Sorry you had to...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does Michael talk about me a lot?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: [pause] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He does? What does he say.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: He says... "I love him." He loves you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: At Cornell, in my fraternity, my house name was "Hubble" because I was so good at finding a party. I was like a powerful space telescope, so... Freshman year, when my skin was still really bad, they called me El Guapo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Big Tuna, tuna?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, I got eel.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [speechless]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [looking for Jim's sushi] Eel... eel.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Didn't see that coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And perhaps the most important person to Indian culture, Sir Ben Kingsley. Because of him, the British left India, and then he became an actor like Ronald Reagan.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Your shirt is buttoned wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, any questions?
